Topic.Title: Shop By Local: Find national brands, locally, with the worlds most relevant local search engine, Krillion

Message.Msg: Local Corporation Provides Location-Based Product Data for Microsoft’s Bing Press Release: Local Corporation – Thu, Sep 5, 2013 7:30 AM EDT.. . IRVINE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Local Corporation (LOCM), a leading online local media company, today announced that the company has signed an agreement with Microsoft, Inc. to provide location-based local product data for Bing. As part of the agreement, Local Corporation’s Krillion™ shopping data platform is helping power Bing’s local product search results, including relevant retail locations, brands, categories, and product availability data and details.

Topic.Title: Amazon to offer free smart phone....really

Message.Msg: well actually people amazon maybe if they were wise about it and lure in the cheapskates be able to pull this off. if they do ads+ search like many suggest then they may be able to make some money from users free phone for searching and ads basically with data plan because people will not get a phone that eats up their data plan and then some. because dataplans are where the cost lay not the phone per say. anyone can afford a 100-200 smartphone but the data plan costs 500-1000s of dollars each year. eliminate that and you are golden. lets say they make 1 penny per ad at login like some apps already are doing say each day you login or swipe at home screen 20x then it is 20 cents per day per year it would be 73 dollars. 20 x 365 = 73 also that is 20 ads per day then what if it was 100? then it would be 5 fold 365 dollars then and recouping the smart phone cost. how much would advertisers pay? google is already charging 0.05 -3.00+ cents per click to advertisers using search so if amazon can even make 1 penny off one ad then they can recoup the investment in a few years. maybe the proposition has a return of 30-40% per year if done correctly. the problem is the data plans AGAIN not the PHONE ITSELF PERSAY. if they give you a free smartphone that runs well even with the ads and basically adware on it would you still use it? of course. the problem is the DATA. it has always been the data that is CRIPPLING the eCommerce industry in the mobile space. how will amazon implement the data plans are the telling factor. some providers are using sprint network now to provide free data services while using ads which is not a new idea. amazon can do the same. I dont know how much is the cost of data though for these corporation which have higher purchasing power than us. if they can get it down to less than 10-20 dollars per month then they would be golden they need to find out how many times their ads will be displayed per day first though
